Package comp3110.mechanismsDomain

Class ApplicationEventQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • comp3110.mechanismsDomain.ApplicationEventQueue
  • public class ApplicationEventQueue
extends java.lang.Object
    All events generated in xtUML models are put on to the ApplicationEventQueue for later asynschronous processing. There is a single event queue for an entire application.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static EventQueue eventQueue  
      private static int MAX_QUEUE_LENGTH

    • Method Detail

      • generateEvent

        public static void generateEvent​(int event,
                                 java.lang.Object parameters,
                                 ActiveClass target)
        Queues an event to a specific target object. This method is used to implement event generation actions.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to be queued
        parameters - an object that contains parameters associated with the event
        target - the object to which the event is directed

      • generateDelayedEvent

        public static void generateDelayedEvent​(long delay,
                                        int event,
                                        java.lang.Object parameters,
                                        ActiveClass target)
        Queues an event to a specific target object after a specified delay.
        Parameters:
        delay - the delay before the event is queued (in milliseconds)
        event - the event to be queued
        parameters - an object that contains parameters associated with the event
        target - the object to which the event is directed

      • getEvent

        private static EventInstance getEvent()

      • start

        public static void start()
        Starts a loop that reads an event from the queue and then dispatches it to the associated target object. This method is called by the applications main program after all domains are initialised.
